result.rationale: This species is considered as Endangered according to criteria B1ab(iii)+2ab(iii): the extent of occurrence (EOO) is estimated to be less than 5,000 km<sup>2</sup> (312 km<sup>2</sup>), the area of occupancy (AOO) is estimated to be less than 500 km<sup>2</sup> (312 km<sup>2</sup>), it is known to exist at no more than five locations (one), and there is a continuing decline inferred in area, extent and quality of habitat due to modification and degradation of the habitat primarily for agriculture.
result.geographicrange: This species is only known from the upper río Tebicuary-mi in the province of Caaguazú in Paraguay, Paraguay river basin (Staeck 2006).
result.population: No data on the population trend of this species is available.
result.habitat: Field observations at the type locality indicate that the habitats preferred by Gymnogeophagus caaguazuensis are bare sandy bottoms among rocky areas in small rivulets, which may have a strong current during the rainy season. During the dry season and the period of low water, this species is found in pools and ponds with more or less stagnant water. Water data collected in February at the type locality were as follows: pH 7.9; electrical conductivity 240 μS/cm; and water temperature 24.2 °C. The associated fish fauna included Phalloceros caudimaculatus (Poeciliidae), Rineloricaria sp. (Loricariidae) and two small characid species (Staeck 2006).
result.threats: This species inhabits an area highly modified by intensive agriculture and deforestation.
result.conservationmeasures: No conservation actions are directed towards this species.
result.usetrade: This species is an object of the aquarium trade.
